TextpageLeftNav.bodyText:
Virtual Machines

The Windows Server and Linux Server can be started within a few minutes. You can fully control the server in the cloud and maintain it according to your business needs.

Apply for a 1RMB Trial Buy Now

We support Virtual Machines of multiple scales. The Virtual Machine permits billing by the minute and listing of pricing by hourly rates. We will charge you by total minutes when the running time of your Virtual Machine is less than 1 hour.

Types of Virtual Machines

  • Windows
  • Linux
  • SQL Server for Windows
  • SQL Server Ubuntu Linux / Machine Learning Server
  • General Purpose
  • Computing Prioritization
  • Memory Prioritization

General purpose: balancing of CPU to memory ratio. Suitable for testing and development of small- and medium-sized databases and low- and medium-traffic Web servers.

The A Series Basic tier provides a cost-effective option for developing/testing the workload and other applications not requiring load balancing, Autoscale or memory-intensive Virtual Machines.

Av2 Standard

The Av2 Standard Virtual Machine is the latest generation of A Series Virtual Machine, which has similar CPU performance but a faster disk speed. These Virtual Machines are suitable for developing workloads, generating servers, code memory, low-traffic website and Web Apps, microservices, early product trials, and small databases. The same as the previous A Standard, Av2 Virtual Machines will include load balancing and Autoscale, and with no extra fees.

F series/FS series

The F Series/FS Series Virtual Machine supports RAM of every CPU core 2 GiB and 16 GiB local solid state disk (SSD), and has been prioritized for computing-intensive workloads. The F Series/FS Series are based on the 2.4 GHz Intel Xeon® E5-2673 v3 (Haswell) processor, which can reach up to a 3.2 GHz clock speed using Intel Turbo Boost Technology 2.0. These Virtual Machines are suitable for batch processing, Web servers, analysis and gaming programs, etc.
For permanent storage, please use the FS Virtual Machines, and purchase Premium Storage separately. The pricing and billing standards for the FS size are the same as for the F Series.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly pricing estimates are based on 744 hours of usage per month.

IP Address Options

Every cloud service option including one or multiple Azure Virtual Machines is automatically assigned a free dynamic virtual IP (VIP) address. For an additional fee, you can also get:

  • Instance-level public IP address:a dynamic public IP (PIP) address assigned to the Virtual Machine for direct access.
  • Reserved IP address: this may be a public IP address reserved for subscription, or used as a VIP address for any cloud service within the region.
  • Load balancing IP address: other load balancing VIP addresses could be assigned to cloud services that include one or multiple Azure Virtual Machines.
Learn about IP address pricing

FAQs

Expand all

Common

  • Is local disk storage billed separately?

    No. All new Virtual Machines have an OS disk and a local disk (also called the “resource disk”). We don’t charge for local disk storage. The OS disk is charged at the common disk rate. Please refer to the configurations of all Virtual Machines.

  • What is a temporary disk?

    Temporary disk is storage that is attached directly to the deployed VM. Data on a temporary disk is lost once the VM is shut down. If you need persistent storage, there are a number of types and sizes of persistent data disks available that are charged separately. Please see thestorage pricing pagefor information. For persistent VM storage, we recommend that you use Managed Disks to take advantage of better management features, scalability, availability, and security.

  • Is there still a charge if the instances I deploy indicate “Suspended”?

    Maybe. If the status indicates “Suspended (de-allocated)”, no charging is performed. If the status indicates “Suspended (allocated)”, the allocated virtual core (not the software license itself) will still be charged. You may view all details about the status of the Virtual Machines.

    Status Billed Detailed information
    Starting up Yes Initial startup status of the Virtual Machines. In such case, they’re experiencing a startup cycle. As the Virtual Machines are running, billing will be conducted.
    Running (already started) Yes Running status of Virtual Machine
    Suspended Yes If the Virtual Machine is suspended (but not de-allocated), software billing is not performed, but core billing is performed.
    Note: If you want to place a Virtual Machine in a “Suspended” status, please use the power supply option within the Virtual Machine (not from Azure Classic portal).
    Deleted (de-allocated) No We will no longer allocate the core to the Virtual Machine, nor charge for it.
    Please note - the only way to suspend all Virtual Machines in the Cloud Service is to delete temporary deployment and production deployment simultaneously.
  • Does the pricing of Virtual Machine instances include the storage cost associated with the running mirror image?

    The pricing of the VM includes only local disk storage. You can view the expenses of attaching Premium Disk (based on SSD) and Standard Disk (based on HDD) onto the VM on the Managed Disk pricing page.

  • How are A Series instances charged?

    In the past, all usage of A0, A2, A3 and A4 standard and basic VMs was issued as the submultiple (A0) or multiple (A2, A3 and A4) of A1 Virtual Machine calculating minutes. We’ve learned that this has caused some trouble for our customers, so we’ve made some changes and allocated the usage per second to dedicated A0, A2, A3 and A4 pricing calculators. As a result, the resource GUID of A0, A2, A3 and A4 VMs may vary. If you have any billing procedures depending on the resource GUID, you’re required to modify them to take into consideration these new pricing calculators.

    Deployment Sizes On 10 January 2016, usage was issued as a multiple of A1 Since 11 January 2016, usage was issued by private pricing calculator
    A0 0.25 A1 hours 1 A0 hours
    A2 2 A1 hours 1 A2 hours
    A3 4 A1 hours 1 A3 hours
    A4 8 A1 hours 1 A4 hours
  • If my Virtual Machine has run 6 minutes, 45 seconds, how much do you charge me?

    We will charge you by the integral minutes of the running the Virtual Machine, so you’re not required to pay for any extra seconds. In this instance the charging is performed according to a usage time of 6 minutes.

  • What’s an Internal Load Balancer?

    This is a new preview feature for Azure Virtual Machines with private IP address. Only in the Virtual Network (for VMs within Virtual Networks) or Cloud Services (for VMs outside Virtual Networks) can you access the terminals through the Internal Load Balancer. The Internal Load Balancer is very useful for multiple level applications not publishing some application levels but also requiring load balancing features.

  • How do we view if the Virtual Machine has stopped correctly without being charged?

    You may check the state of the Virtual Machine in the “Virtual Machine” Options tab and the Virtual Machine instrument board. Charging is still performed if the status of the Virtual Machine is “Suspended”. No charging is performed only when the state is “Suspended (de-allocated)”.

    To ensure there is no charge, please always suspend the VM from the management portal. You can also suspend the VM by calling “PostShutdownAction” equal to ShutdownRoleOperation of “StoppedDeallocated” through Powershell.

  • How do you charge data transfer fees if I have instances in two different regions?

    Charge every instance’s cross-regional data transfer.

  • Does the aforementioned pricing include tax?

    Yes, the pricing listed includes tax.

  • Can the server license be transferred to Azure and run on a Virtual Machine?

    Yes, if there is a software guarantee, the server products supported by all Virtual Machines are licensed through license mobility.

Windows Server

  • Do I need to provide my license key if I upload my local Windows Server mirror to Azure?

    No. Microsoft will provide the Windows Server license key for the currently running instance.

  • Can the license be transferred if I download Azure Windows Server Mirror to my data center?

    No. You need to provide the license for this mirror.

SQL Server

  • When can I use Azure SQL Database? When can I use SQL Server?

    If you want to migrate existing applications or workloads into the cloud or expand some local applications to the cloud, SQL Server in the Virtual Machine is the easiest option. If you want to build new relational applications, SQL Database may be an optimal long-term solution. No matter which of these two methods you adopt, you can use Azure to easily shift the applications between the on-site data center and the cloud according to the changing business requirements.

  • Which edition of SQL Server 2017 should I select?

    To help you make a selection, we provide a detailed features comparison.

  • Is there any difference from SQL Server Enterprise’s DW edition?

    The installation, configuration and optimization of data warehouses (DW) represent typical complex workloads. You can improve the performance of these workloads through DW mirrors specially optimized for Azure Virtual Machines, which could surpass at most 20% of the common SQL Server Enterprise VM mirrors. View the working principles.

  • Is it necessary to purchase a Windows Virtual Machine separately?

    No. The pricing in the table above is the total pricing of the Windows Virtual Machine and SQL Server.

Support and Service Level Agreements

If you have any questions or need any help, please visit Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

For all Virtual Machines deployed with two or more instances in the same availability, we guarantee that you can have VM connection at least 99.95% of the time. For any single-instance Virtual Machine that uses Premium Storage for all disks, we guarantee that you can have VM connection at least 99.9% of the time. To learn more about the details of our Service Level Agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.

You can also make a direct purchase and become an Azure Pay-in-Advance customer.
